Module project.chenlin_17
Package project.chenlin_17.Controller

Class CharacterOptionsController

java.lang.Object
project.chenlin_17.Controller.CharacterOptionsController
public class CharacterOptionsController extends Object
This class is the controller of the character option page
Version:
Version1.0
update: December 28th
Author:
Lin CHEN

  • Constructor Details

    • CharacterOptionsController

      public CharacterOptionsController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This function is to initialize the controller.
      When first loading the page, make sure that the all the property have been bounded with the size,so that the scene is resizable.

    • adjustHeightSpacing

      private void adjustHeightSpacing(javafx.scene.layout.VBox intend, double value)
      This function adjust the node's spacing property in the whole pane by binding with its height property.
      Parameters:
      intend - stands for the corresponding changed node.
      value - stands for the proposition of intend node' property in the whole pane.

    • adjustWidthSpacing

      private void adjustWidthSpacing(javafx.scene.layout.HBox intend, javafx.scene.Node refer, double value)
      This function adjusts the nodes' spacing property in the referred node by binding with its width property.
      Parameters:
      intend - stands for the correspondingly changed node
      refer - stands for the changing node
      value - stands for the proposition of intend node' property in the referred node

    • setChooseProperty

      private void setChooseProperty(javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      This function adjust the Label node to the chooseVbox and set its proposition for height and width.
      Parameters:
      label - stands for correspondingly changed label node.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(WorldBuilder worldBuilder, ArrayList<CharacterOptions> characterOptions)
      This function is intended to initialize the showing nodes for the character choose class.
      Because the content in this page will change according to users' previous options for the theme setting.
      Parameters:
      worldBuilder - accepts the world builder's type from the previous setting
      characterOptions - accepts the showing scene for the character, which allows the user to make further choice in this page

    • Complete

      public void Complete()
      This function is intended for building the world according to the user's choice.
      This completes the unfinished scene left by the previous page.
      It adds the paddle, the ball, the wall set and the background music.

    • buildWall

      private void buildWall(double width, double height, int options)
      This function allows worldBuilder to build the wall group.
      Parameters:
      width - expected wall container length
      height - expected wall container height
      options - users' choice for the set choosing

    • buildPaddle

      private void buildPaddle(double width, double height)
      This function allows the worldBuilder to build the paddle.
      If it is the general world builder, then the paddle is built according to the color the user had chosen.
      If it is the advanced world builder, then the paddle is expected to be black.
      Parameters:
      width - expected paddle container length
      height - expected paddle container height

    • buildBall

      private void buildBall(double width, double height)
      This function allows the worldBuilder to build the ball.
      Only the general world builder will utilize the color here.
      Because in the advanced world builder, it uses the ImageBall and the ball face have been removed and the color actually doesn't matter.
      Parameters:
      width - expected ball container length
      height - expected ball container height

    • getColor

      private javafx.scene.paint.Color getColor(javafx.scene.control.ToggleGroup toggleGroup)
      Parameters:
      toggleGroup - get user's final choice for the color of the ball and paddle in the string format
      Returns:
      the color value that will be used for building the ball and paddle in Color format

    • ToSceneChoice

      public void ToSceneChoice(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This function allows user to reset the theme choice.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - do when mouse are clicked
